• Scalaz
  • Type classes
    • Equal

  • STARS--

Apply

A strong lax semi-monoidal endofunctor. This is equivalent to an Applicative without pure.

In addition to the laws of a Functor, an Apply instance needs to satisfy the following law:

  • Associativity: Apply.ap(Apply.ap(x)(fs1))(fs2) === Apply.ap(x)(Apply.ap(fs1)(fs2))

Typical imports

import scalaz.Scalaz._

Instance declaration

scala> import scalaz.ct.ApplyClass
<console>:15: error: object ct is not a member of package scalaz
       import scalaz.ct.ApplyClass
                     ^
scala> val listApply: Apply[List] = instanceOf(new ApplyClass[List] {
     |   def ap[A, B](fa: List[A])(f: List[A => B]): List[B] = fa.zip(f).map(t => t._2(t._1))
     |   def map[A, B](ma: List[A])(f: A => B): List[B] = ma.map(f)
     | })
<console>:15: error: not found: type Apply
       val listApply: Apply[List] = instanceOf(new ApplyClass[List] {
                      ^
<console>:15: error: not found: value instanceOf
       val listApply: Apply[List] = instanceOf(new ApplyClass[List] {
                                    ^
<console>:15: error: not found: type ApplyClass
       val listApply: Apply[List] = instanceOf(new ApplyClass[List] {
                                                   ^

Usage

     | val f1: Int => Int = _ + 3
     | val f2: Int => Int = _ - 2
     | 
     | List(1, 2, 3).ap(List(f1, f2, f1))
